On Tuesday 29 November 2005 18:32, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> The short answer: there is a way to make JUnit do this, but many of us
> don't like to do it that way. For a test like this, I might do the
> following:
>
> List failedUrls = new ArrayList();
> foreach (URL url : urlsToTest) {
>      if (failed(url)) {
>          failedUrls.add(url);
>      }
> }
> assertTrue(failedUrls.isEmpty());

I would use

    assertEquals( new ArrayList(), failedUrls );

[and might well have a constant `emptyList` around], on the grounds
that when the Unfortunate Event of test failure occurs the default
failure message of assertEquals will tell me which URLs failed.

-- 
Chris "another virtual machine" Dollin
"Certainly the absence of a smiley is not a syntax error or a constraint
 violation, and therefore doesn't require a diagnostic." (Richard Heathfield)
